result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alberto Sarmiento Teran

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

8:34 AM Defendant Alberto Sarmiento Teran in court.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening in court for Alberto Sarmiento Teran.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Maria Marin (SWITS) appeared by Zoom as interpreter and sworn in.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR THE NEXT HEARING.
Hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Letter filed by Atty Luening**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 10/13 "The 10/14/22 matter may be adjourned provided counsel waives time limits but the adjourned date MUST be in person."

ADDRESS INFO for Alberto Sarmiento Teran
Current: 301 Morris Street  #10, Pewaukee, WI 53072 United States  (Effective: 10-05-2022)
Prior: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd., Waukesha, WI 53186 United States

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

1:58 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Alberto Sarmiento Teran in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Tyler Luening appeared by Zoom for Alberto Sarmiento Teran. Dawn Maldonado appeared by Zoom as interpreter and previously sworn.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 

SPANISH INTERPRETER NEEDED FOR NEXT COURT DATE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Alberto Sarmiento Teran

Prior: 301 Morris St #10, Pewaukee, WI 53072

District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. Defendant is not able to come to court today.  Defendant can appear by zoom for 10/4/2022 hearing.
